name: B. Playing with GCD
statement:
You are given an integer array a of length n. Does there exist an array
b consisting of n+1 positive integers such that a_i=
gcd (b_i,b_{i+1}) for all i (1
leq i
leq n)? Note that
gcd(x, y) denotes the greatest common divisor (GCD) of integers x and y.
